reviews.negative_text: En p√©riode de crise, tout client trouve que tout est "trop cher" et tout h√¥telier probablement que cela ne l'est pas assez. La diff√©rence se fait donc sur la prise d'initiative. Dans le cas pr√©sent 2 bonnes initiatives vis √† vis des humains composant notre famille ont √©t√© constat√©es ce qui est tr√®s positif. Seul "b√©mol" : notre famille comportant des canid√©s ( dans notre cas chien de travail de type berger ) qui DOIVENT de part leur travail voyager avec leur ma√Ætre, nous aurions appr√©cier qu'une "gratuit√©" comme elle est pratiqu√©e en g√©n√©ral s'applique aussi √† nos canid√©s. Par analogie on n 'imagine pas faire payer un suppl√©ment canne √† une personne qui boite et donc on peut s'interroger sur un "suppl√©ment chien" pour un aveugle ! Cependant il faut garder en t√™te que les h√¥teliers acceptant les canid√©s ont le m√©rite de le faire et qu'en ce sens nos canid√©s nous ont donc accompagn√©s. Bref, l'id√©e ici n'est pas de d√©courager l'initiative d'acceptation des canid√©s au contraire mais de permettre une r√©flexion quant √† la nature des canid√©s qui impliquent aucun "travail" suppl√©mentaire √† l'h√¥telier. Dans le m√™me ordres d'id√©es les h√¥teliers font la distinction entre enfant de moins XYZ ann√©es par exemple. Alors pourquoi ne pas faire par exemple une distinction entre canid√© titulaire du CSAU ( Certificat de Sociabilit√© et d'Aptitude √† l'Utilisation ) que tout canid√© peut passer en France, d'une part et canid√© dont le propri√©taire ( "ma√Ætre" ) n'a pas pris la peine de passer d'autre part ? Cela serait une distinction l√©gitime car CSAU : implique comportement OK du canid√© et du ma√Ætre jug√© par des juges dont c'est le METIER. Pas de CSAU alors implique comportement inconnu et donc dans ce cas l'h√¥telier souhaite √™tre r√©mun√©r√© pour ce "risque". J'invite cet h√¥telier et d'autres FORTEMENT √† y r√©fl√©chir.

reviews.review_title: Lovely dog friendly hotel right on the beach (but no dogs actually allowed on the beach :( )
reviews.positive_text: This is a very cute and comfortable hotel right on the beach. The location couldn't be better. The room was good, a little small but perfectly comfortable and I really liked the fact we had a communal kitchen/lounge area on our floor (we could eat pizza here for a more relaxed dinner one evening). And of course they accept dogs (we have two sausage dogs) - which i love!! The hotel.os in a great spot, the start of the promenade of shops, restaurants and beach bars. And the beach is beautiful! Free parking in the surrounding streets which was also good, although you have to hunt to find a spot of you're looking at prime beach hours!
reviews.negative_text: There's nothing I didn't like relating to the hotel. It was quite pricey - the restaurant as well as the hotel. I didn't like (not the hotel but I think relevant if you are travelling with dogs) that dogs aren't allowed on the beach,  even after busy times and not even on a lead (e.g early morning or late at night), just something to be aware of if you're travelling here with dogs during high season (May - October).

reviews.review_title: Staff could have interacted more,offered a refreshment.nicely situated.
reviews.positive_text: Location on the beach front.Restaurant looked inviting .
reviews.negative_text: Bedroom was very sixties,dated ,small.we were afraid to open window as there was elevated path and you could step into our room.it was roasting that night.Breakfast should have been included for the price we paid.Tea making facilities was only camomile tea.no regular tea or coffee and had to put kettle on floor.

reviews.positive_text:
Booked this hotel for our road trip .it was our last but one night on route back to st malo.
I dont think i can praise this hotel enough in a text .i new it was going to be a good stay .the hotel is opposite the beach .a very long 20 ft away .they have tables on edge of the beach to have drinks at and a seating restaurant on the edge of the beach .we sat there for our evening meal .the food was tremendous. We sat and watched the sun set aswell .it really is a magical place to sit .the staff at the hotel were very polite and welcomeing .our room was very very clean .not the biggest but great for what we needed .there is free on street parking to the side streets which is a bonus.breakfast was ok .not ghe biggest selection but fresh none the less.if you like being somewhere beautifull and scenic this is the place to book .were not home yet but are  planning our next stay .
reviews.negative_text: Room was a little hot but so was everywhere with the current climate .

reviews.positive_text: The staff were lovely, the location fantastic and the dinner and breakfast very good.  We only booked to spend the night on a longer journey but I was very impressed. A simple place, but excellent for a 2* hotel.
